title: Update dependencies and use modern rust
body: Apparently when I first wrote this, we didn't have async/await! This updates pretty much all the dependencies (except `clap` as that's too big a refactor for little gain), and switches from manually constructing futures to using async/await which makes the code a lot more readable. I'm sure there's other refactors but I was just focusing on updating the dependencies and got side tracked :)

title: GCC Compiler dependency
body: without the gcc compiler it does not compile in an environment

title: Expose stats on queue size
body:
For diagnostics purposes, it is helpful to have statistics on the queue size, to expose the current queue size.

A new status command is implemented:

```shell
curl -d '{"action":"status"}' localhost:7076
```

```json
{
    "queue_size": 2
}
```

Fixes #24

title: Benchmark action
body:
Use with `{"action":"benchmark", "count":"N"}` and optionals for difficulty and multiplier.

Example response when setting an optional multiplier "2" :
```json
{
    "average": "6084",
    "count": "2",
    "difficulty": "fffffffc00000000",
    "duration": "12168",
    "hint": "Times in milliseconds",
    "multiplier": "2"
}
```

Also formatted the rust files, IDE decided to be fancy.

title: Artifact updates
body:
add nix sha256sum to release artifacts
Add windows artifact and sha256sum for release artifacts

title: Rewrite OpenCL kernel for performance optimizations
fix(readme): Revise work_validate example response
body:
In the nano node version V21, the `valid` is no longer included in the response, and uses the new response fields `valid_all` and `valid_receive` to replace it.

More information: https://docs.nano.org/commands/rpc-protocol/#work_validate

title: Update for node release v21
body:
- Removed `beta` flag no one uses. Maintaining this is too difficult with the difficulty changes. Program will error if that flag is given. This is not necessary for distributed work requests as those include the absolute difficulty
- Update threshold to 8x current
- Add lower receive threshold
- Follow changes to work_validate

title: Initial CI for linux using github actions
body:
- Build parallel debug+release on push/pr
- Upload artifact on tagging which creates a release

Example tag on my branch which auto-created the release: https://github.com/guilhermelawless/nano-work-server/releases/tag/ci-example-1

title: Optional shuffle mode
body:
If `--shuffle` is given, the next work item is picked randomly instead of sequentially.

Pro:
- Increased efficiency with multiple servers

Con:
- If the queue is growing over time instead of shrinking, some requests might take a long time to get to

With 2 servers in LAN I get 4 seconds to generate 1000 works (beta difficulty) vs 6 seconds. It only takes one of the servers to be in shuffle mode.

More information in https://github.com/nanocurrency/nano-node/pull/2713
